text:
I'm only asking because I believe I have it toggled off yet my account details shows
```{"asctime": "2022-03-27 10:59:58,616", "levelname": "INFO", "message": "Client update account details", "username": "username", "exchange": "Betfair", "betting_client": "APIClient", "current_transaction_count_total": 0, "transaction_count_total": 0, "trading_controls": ["<flumine.controls.clientcontrols.MaxTransactionCount object at 0x0000023775B21D00>"], "order_stream": false, "best_price_execution": true, "paper_trade": false}```

text: Isn't that just a flumine setting for simulation?

elements.text: Isn't that just a flumine setting for simulation?

text: Nope, it's from a live client

elements.text: Nope, it's from a live client

text:
my guess:
• base client defaults best_price_execution to True if unspecified
• base client doesn't update the attribute ever (as it would need to recieve updates to the attribute when someone changes it via website UI)
• base client doesn't update the account setting on server-side if this attribute were to be changed programmatically
• best_price_execution attribute is only used in simulation

elements.text: my guess:
base client defaults best_price_execution to True if unspecified
base client doesn't update the attribute ever (as it would need to recieve updates to the attribute when someone changes it via website UI)
base client doesn't update the account setting on server-side if this attribute were to be changed programmatically
best_price_execution attribute is only used in simulation

text: so the presence of it being True on a live client is just a red herring.

elements.text: so the presence of it being True on a live client is just a red herring.

text: In many cases if the price has moved such that you get filled at a better price than you asked for, it means that something fundamental has changed during the time it took for your bet to become live and you probably don't want that bet filled, you want the chance to re-evaluate what bet to place

text: That's not how it works. Think of it like this: the matcher runs as normal. If your bet would be subject to BPE then the bet fails

text: so without BPE you only get filled if there is an opposite order at the same price you request, whereas without BPE you might get filled also by an order at a better price?

elements.text: so without BPE you only get filled if there is an opposite order at the same price you request, whereas without BPE you might get filled also by an order at a better price?

text: Without BPE you only get filled if the price you request is available and there is no better price available
